abstract: Natasha Singer Technophoria column examines innovations at the Josie Robertson Surgery Center, new $300 million outpatient facility founded by Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in New York City; notes facility's focus on patient data-gathering could lead to improved service, but also treads upon ethical grey area in which patients' privacy rights are not firmly established by law.
lead_paragraph: At a Memorial Sloan Kettering outpatient surgery center in Manhattan, innovations include data tracking and other techniques to improve care, but some worry about transparency.

headline.main: A Surgery Center That Doubles as an Idea Lab
headline.print_headline: A Surgery Center That Doubles as an Idea Lab

snippet: At a Memorial Sloan Kettering outpatient surgery center in Manhattan, innovations include data tracking and other techniques to improve care, but some worry about transparency.
